result.execSummary:
The defendant David W. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs/DNA & Domestic surcharges.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: 15% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Comply with same conditions as stated in 14CF337.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David W. Adams in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant David W. Adams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF239, 14CF337, 15CF68
10:34 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Court and both counsel have received the revocation packet. 
Atty Renc states corrections/additions to the packet. 

Court has received 2 letters filed by Atty Renc. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
14CF337 & 15CF68 -
Serve 40 months with 20 months Initial Confinement followed by 20 months Extended Supervision on each, concurrent. 
189 days of credit. 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

14CF239 -
9 months jail, concurrent with 14CF337 & 15CF68

Atty Knaapen recommends the conditions of probation be the same as those for Extended Supervision. 
Atty Renc makes arguments re: DAAP. 

BY THE COURT: 
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Participate in any counseling recommended as necessary and appropriate by the agent. 
Comply with recommendations from the AODA he previously had, if there are any. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with Rachel Adams unless approved by the agent.  
Comply with CHIPS order regarding placement and visitation.
Court permits visitation at the discretion of the agent, if agent approves arrangement other than contact thru a 3rd party.  
Sign any releases of information that the agent deems necessary. 
Pay the fines and costs on each as referenced on page 7. 

Atty Knaapen argues for 25% of prison money. 
Atty Renc argues for 15% of prison money. 

BY THE COURT: 
15% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Statement Regarding Recusal - original filed in 14CF239

Defendant David W. Adams in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant David W. Adams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:34 a.m. case is called 
14cm73, 14CF239, 14CF337, 14CF338, 15CF68
Appearances are stated on the record by ADA Knaapen.
Parties are anticipation of plea/sentencing 
ADA Knaapen recites the agreement  in 14CF239:  CT 2 - plea; Ct 3 - plea with repeater enhancer; Ct 1 - DRI
Sentence on Ct. 2; 5 mo jail - imposed and stayed; sentence withheld on count 2, probation for 24 months
Conditions of probation:  Fine of $500 plus costs include DNA surcharge and domestic abuse charge; apply any bond money; 
AODA unless one has been completed and comply with treatment as result of treatment;  maintain absolute sobriety; obtain or maintain full time employment
Complete domestic abuse alternative program and any other counseling recommended by counsel; provide DNA sample; NO contact with Rachel Adams unless approve by agent; Contact with children would have to be with a person approved by agent

Pay Court costs on bailjumping

14CF337:  Plea to Ct with repeater enhancer - withheld sentence; 
24 mos concurrent probation with Same conditions of probation

15CF68:  Plea to Count 2 with repeater;  State moves to dismiss the repeat enhancer; Ct 1, 3 & 4 are DRI;
w/h sentence
24 mos probation: Pay Court costs; DNA surcharge and Domestic abuse surcharge

14CF338: Both counts DRI

Defendant plea:  
14CF239
Ct 2 as a repeater - NC
Ct. 3 as a repeater - NC

14CF337
Felony bailjumping as repeater - NC

15CF68:  Ct 2 felony bailjumping as repeater - NC
On the motion of state, the charge of dangerous weapon is stricken

Defendant verifies signature on Plea Questionnaire.  
Court questions Defendant regarding plea and plea questionnaire
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.

Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Defendant does not make a statement as to the facts.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

14CF239
Court questions re: previous conviction of 2012 - defendant agrees
Ct. 2 - found guilty 947.01(1) 973.055(1) and 939.62(1)(b) & (2)
Ct. 3 - found guilty misdemeanor bailjumping as repeater 
Ct 1 - DRI

14CF337
Court finds guilty of felony bailjumping as repeater 

15CF68
Court finds guilty under count 2 of felony bailjumping as repeater 
On the Motion of state, counts 1, 3 & 4 are DRI

14CF338 cts 1 & 2 are DRI

No request for PSI by either attorney

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not make statement.

BY THE COURT:
14CF239
Ct 2 - 150 days in county jail w/huber privileges for work and any AODA treatment - STAYED
Probation - 24 mos.
Conditions:
--Fine $500 plus costs
--Pay DNA surchage and domestic abuse surcharge
--Apply bond to fine and costs and surcharges and balance to be paid within 60 days from today
--AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations and provide a release to agent if AODA completed so confirm the AODA assessment
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--Maintain full time employment
--Sign a release so agent can determine that he participated and completed in Domestic abuse alternative program
--Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent
--Provide a DNA sample if not already provided
--No contact with Rachel Adam unless approved with the agent
--Only Contact with children shalll be with a third party and approved by agent unless agent approves some other arrangement

If the defendant successfully completes probation,  the Court will consider early disharage

Ct. 3 - withheld sentence concurrent
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of count 2 and pay costs

14CF337
Sentence w/held
Probation 24 mos concurrent
Condition:  Follow conditions on 14CF239
--pay costs including DNA surcharge

15CF68
Count 2 - sentence withheld
Probation - 2 years concurrent
Conditions:  comply with conditions in 14CF239 and 14CF337
--Pay costs including DNA surcharge and also include domestic abuse surcharge

and Notice of Motion

Defendant David W. Adams in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant David W. Adams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.

Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
